alert.note: Alert for Howard (Maryland) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Baltimore/Washington (Washington D.C., Central Maryland, Northern Virginia, Eastern West Virginia)
info.headline: Flood Warning issued January 10 at 6:05AM EST until January 11 at 12:08AM EST by NWS Baltimore/Washington
info.description: ...FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL 10 AM EST THIS MORNING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues. * WHERE...Portions of central and northern Maryland, including the following counties, in central Maryland, Anne Arundel, Howard and Prince Georges. In northern Maryland, Baltimore and Baltimore City. * WHEN...Until 1000 AM EST. * IMPACTS...Flooding of rivers, creeks, streams, and other low-lying and flood-prone locations is imminent or occurring. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 605 AM EST, gauge reports indicated heavy rain. Flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly in the warned area. Between 2 and 3 inches of rain have fallen. - Additional rainfall amounts up to 0.1 inches are possible in the warned area. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Baltimore... Columbia... Bowie... Severn... Pikesville... College Park... Crofton... Middle River... Greenbelt... Langley Park... Beltsville... Elkridge... Riviera Beach... Bladensburg... Historic Ellicott City... Baltimore-Washington Airport... Sparrows Point... University of Maryland... Glen Burnie... Ellicott City... - Please visit www.weather.gov/safety/flood for flood safety and preparedness information
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding. Please report observed flooding to local emergency services or law enforcement and request they pass this information to the National Weather Service when you can do so safely.
